txt.en: Completed
'Through smoke and blood we pressed, but against Mordor's gates even the Great Alliance broke like waves upon the strand.'
'So, at last, was the Land of Shadows laid bare - but Gil-galad's eyes filled not with triumph but with anguish.'
'They blazed bright as stars, crimson and sapphire, and he too shone, silver-white. This, then, was the unveiled wrath of the Eldar, not seen in Middle-earth since the Elder days.'
Pages of a journal can be found scattered across Mordor Besieged. Perhaps you can complete it if you find them all.
'Gil-galad nodded, then grew stern again. \qBut so, too, did he behold mine. And though Sauron's own Ring is powerful, he now fears what I might do with mine.\q'
'\qRightly so,\q said Círdan. \qFor the Enemy will see.\q The Elvenking nodded. \qStill, what other choice remains? How many more of our people must die because of my doubt?\q'

The story is complete. You believe this is an account of Gil-galad's shattering of the Morannon written by High-King Elendil himself. Perhaps if you bring it to him, he will be able to comment further.
Collect Page 5
'They sought to discourage him, but he would not be daunted, and so, though it pained them, Elrond and Círdan both came forward.'
Collect Page 6
Collect Page 7
'He sank to his knees, and Elrond and Círdan at once took hold of him. His strength spent, he let them wrest the Rings from his hands.'
Collect Page 8
'It was upon the battle-plain of Dagorlad, where for months we had spent our blood against the Enemy, that at last I understood the Elven-king's power.'
Collect Page 9
Collect Page 14
Stark-white pages can be found scattered throughout Mordor Besieged.\n\nYou should collect the pages to complete the story.
Collect Page 15
'\qThese,\q Gil-galad said, \qare Vilya and Narya, two of the three Great Rings saved from Sauron's vengeance when he brought Eregion to ruin.\q'
Collect Page 16
Collect Page 17
'A shadow fell upon Gil-galad's brow as we met that morn, above fields sown with the dead, and gazed upon that grim bastion.'
Collect Page 18
Collect Page 19
'\qYet to don both,\q Elrond said. \qNever did even the mightiest of the Gwaith-i-Mírdain dare to wear two!\q But Gil-galad's mind was set, and he would not be swayed.'
Collect Page 20
Collect Page 21
'\qAnd what will you do?\q asked Círdan. Gil-galad sighed and shook his head. \qNaught, save at fearful need. I doubt I should survive it a second time.\q'
Lost Lore of the Great Alliance
Collect Page 22
Collect Page 23
You have found the page of a journal, stark-white in contrast to the battle-scarred plain of Gorgoroth. Perhaps you can find other pages in Mordor Besieged and complete the story.
'Terror and awe filled my heart as the storm fell upon the haunted pass, hurling our foes like children's toys, and at last smote the black gates themselves.'
High-King Elendil can be found in Adambel.\n\nIf he is missing, he will return after the Council of the Kings.
Collect Page 24
'Gil-galad nevermore spoke of that day, nor did any behold his full power again. But since, his words have burned in my mind - Sauron's own Ring.'
Collect Page 25
Collect Page 26
'\qCelebrimbor vouchsafed them to me ere his death, then I to those I trusted, for I feared that I might be tempted to use them.\q'
Collect Page 27
Talk to Elendil
'Never in all our days together had I seen him in a mood so grim. \qIt has come to this, then,\q he said, leaning upon Aeglos his spear.'
'\qSince first we rode to war, I have dreaded this day.\q We Men who stood with him did not yet understand, but Gil-galad's captains knew, and they sorrowed.'
Completed.
'He took those dread jewels and, standing on the stony hilltop above the plain's foul reek, slipped them on his fingers, each to one hand.'
'The battlements, which had for so long withstood all our cunning and strength, rent asunder with a roar, and were flung to the earth as splinters and dust.'
'And this thought now haunts my dreams: if the Elf-rings hold such power, what strength might dwell within that of the Dark Lord himself?'
'Though we long strove, besting even the Dark Lord's mightiest servants, those fell ramparts yielded not. Surely the halls of Barad-dûr rang with Sauron's laughter at our despair.'
'A silence fell upon the Dagorlad as Gil-galad raised his hands and spoke words of power: \qLachalagos dan in ennyn vyrn!\q'
'Long had we been friends, and many battles had I fought beside him, but not until the fall of the Black Gate did I behold Gil-galad's true might.'

'Hail, [placeholder]. What have you there?'

You show the High-King the pages you have collected.

'Ah, I had thought this journal lost! You are quite resourceful to have reconstructed this account.

'Indeed, the words here-in are mine. All who were present were shaken to the core by the storm Gil-galad brought forth that day. I am sure you feel the same. Does that surprise you? Even Kings feel fear in the face of real power. And still, the knowledge that the Dark Lord has a ring of power all his own brings me pause. We must bury that fear, and hold on to our courage. This is our last stand against the darkness; Courage is our greatest weapon.'

He hands you the spine from which the journal pages originated.

'Keep this journal for yourself, [placeholder]. Let it be a constant reminder of the power of our Great Alliance, and give you hope in the battles to come. The Enemy may have great power, but so do we.'
Continue adventuring in Mordor Besieged
'\qBut that he guesses not. It may help us before the end.\q The foe fled before us, and we marched to the last great siege.'
Collect Page 10
Collect Page 1
Collect Page 2
Collect Page 3
Collect Page 4
You have found lost pages of a journal authored by Elendil.\n\nYou should continue adventuring in Mordor Besieged.
'Each bore in his hand a golden ring - the Lord of Imladris' set with a gem of deepest blue; the Shipwright's with a stone of flaming red.'
'His light dimmed, and to my eyes he seemed wearier than ever I had seen him before. \qWhat did you see?\q Elrond asked. \qDid you behold his mind?\q'
Collect Page 11
Collect Page 12
'At his beckoning, the storm came - a vast column of fire and rushing wind that fell like a hammer from the wrack above.'
Collect Page 13
